programme.title: America's Greatest Prison Breaks
programme.desc: An account of the breakout of escaped killers Richard Matt and David Sweat from Clinton Correctional Prison in New York, as it was investigated by US Marshals and other officials.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: An insight into the secrets surrounding the 10 biggest and most mysterious conspiracies in history, including the goings-on at Area 51.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Investigating the plans and goals of the world's most secretive organisations, considering whether elite groups of power players could be plotting the fate of the world.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The ten most life-threatening hunts undertaken by the Louisiana hunters.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Faced with storms, currents and deadly gators, the hunters risk life and limb to fill their tags. Revisit the scariest moments of the series in this special episode.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: John Thomson and Simon Day attend an auction of sheep carcasses, go on a snake hunt, and meet a man in the West Midlands with the world's largest collection of latex dolls.

programme.title: A Very British Road Trip with John Thompson and Simon Day
programme.desc: Simon Day and John Thomson explore Lancashire, where they eat the world's biggest breakfast, go clog dancing, and practise taxidermy using roadkill.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley compete to sell the most goods, with the loser having to pay a forfeit. A musician with limited funds seeks a new bass to replace the one he has broken.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les argue over an important decision, while a scientist turns up in the shop claiming his vintage device can cure diseases.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Dave Gorman, Al Murray, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Paul Chowdhry discover which of them is this series' winner.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Matt Lucas, Holly Walsh and Susan Calman join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig opens her post in a post-themed edition. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actress and comedy writer Jennifer Saunders takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with artist Grayson Perry and stand-up Matt Forde joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: Joshua plucks up the courage to ask Naomi out, only to find she's already lined up another date. Ricky's plan to save the day backfires and Mario has a big date of his own to go on.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by presenter Richard Madeley and actor Sanjeev Bhaskar, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes naturalist Kate Humble and comedian Miles Jupp. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Ed Byrne, Gary Delaney, Ivo Graham and Zoe Lyons join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Father and son Bill and Frankie McAteer are killed in an apparent car accident on their way home from work at Billingsgate Market, but Nikki and Jack arrive to discover the younger man's body is riddled with bullets. Back at the Lyell centre, Clarissa summons her husband Max, a digital forensics expert, to help crack the case - and he uncovers disturbing video evidence showing a sexual encounter between Frankie, his girlfriend Becky and best friend Liam. Crime drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives a surprise visit from her father's mistress and is shocked to learn the truth about her financial difficulties, while Evie begins her first day as an apprentice dressmaker. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Boon
programme.desc: Harry falls for jazz club owner Jo Beckett and plans to marry her and invest in the club. He even makes preparations to sell his share of CBS to a rival security firm. Michael Elphick stars in this seasonal episode.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky Midnight News
programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Real Chernobyl
programme.desc: Sky News documentary special meeting people in Ukraine who were involved in the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Hotspots: On the Frontline
programme.desc: Alex Crawford meets former child soldiers in war torn South Sudan, while Stuart Ramsay examines the devastating aftermath of the 2018 California wildfires.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Knocked Up (2007)
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents-to-be decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: Manchester's Olivia Davidson-Slack, and Will Oakley from Southampton take part in the dating show, hosted by Holly Willoughby. Both Olivia and Will must decide which of three potential suitors they would like to accompany on a date, but must make their choice by interviewing their would-be sweetheart's families.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores Trinidad, where he visits a Hindu temple built on land reclaimed from the sea, prepares grilled tamarind tofu with callaloo pesto, and samples a local speciality - curried chickpeas in a fried bread roll. On a visit to Maracas Bay, he makes a coconut Caribbean chai.

programme.title: Magic At The Movies
programme.desc: It's a Magic movie special! We have a collection of gorgeous classic movie soundtracks to score your day.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Man Like Stormzy
programme.desc: There's a Stormzy coming! All the hits from one of the best UK Grime acts.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: The Fresh List
programme.desc: Keep up to date with some of the hottest new videos dropping right now, from some of your favourite artists and introducing some brand new artists.

programme.title: Super Hits & New Releases!
programme.desc: Tune in to these super-hot hits and the latest trending videos. Look no further for today's music fix.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Are We Alone?
programme.desc: Scientists compare the extreme environments of distant worlds with those found in remote areas of Earth, in the hope of gaining new insights in the search for extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons, oversees the clash between Lancashire's The Water's Edge and The Hand and Heart from Peterborough.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Peculiar pedestrians take to the road, and reckless drivers throw caution in the wind. Plus, dash-cams continue to capture people behaving in inexplicable ways.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic compilation of some of the most daring drivers who take speed to the next levels. Featuring unusual pedestrians and a party on wheels like no other.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A collision on a racetrack results in a multi-car pile-up, houses are swept away by floodwaters, a man is sucked into a jet engine, and an F1 powerboat takes off.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A massive explosion occurs at a propane plant, a boat and its passengers are sucked under a ferry, a dragster disintegrates at 130mph, and a racing boat crashes.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revive a rare and valuable fairground ride, then resuscitate a Victorian park bench and a century-old gentleman's suitcase.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: A woman calls in the team to help restore her husband's Nova.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A teacher who cries crystals, a woman with brittle bones, a prematurely aged teenager and a boy with butterfly skin.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Andrew Nesbitt, found dead on his 46th birthday in his Wisconsin apartment after a night out. Officers sought clues from CCTV in local bars, cabs and street corners.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When 12-year-old Alajawan Brown is shot dead outside a shop in Washington, near to an earlier shooting, police refer to CCTV to see if the two are connected. S5/14/16.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic Detectives investigates the thin line between love and hate, while tracking the vicious histories of deadly lovers and their evil spouses.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Report on the trial and conviction of New York Mafia boss Vincent Gigante, nicknamed the Oddfather, who was accused of ordering the deaths of seven gangsters and plotting to kill others as revenge for unsanctioned Mob murders.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The work of the Michigan Humane Society, a four-strong team of animal welfare officers that deals with more than 4,000 cases of cruelty and neglect every year.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown has an all-night marathon in a canine maternity ward, and a rabbit is hit with a bad case of heatstroke.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: HuffPost Live correspondent Caitlyn Becker visits the shop, but cannot decide between two dresses, while another customer wants the first gown she sees.
